title: English (1846) The Illuminated Bible (Study)
description: English (1846) The Illuminated Bible: Harperâ€™s Illuminated Bible, published in 1846, stands out for its unique and exquisite design. Each floriated initial in this Bible is distinct and intricately detailed, with the letter A alone featuring over 353 different engravings. The Bible contains 185 large illustrations, complemented by more than 1,400 wood engravings created by John Chapman, an artist whose work is also featured in the rotunda of the U.S. Capitol building in Washington, D.C. Due to its elaborate and costly production process, the publishers released it in fifty-four monthly installments. Today, only one hundred complete sets of this edition are known to exist.
